metadata.title: CVE-2019-1387 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: An issue was found in Git before v2.24.1, v2.23.1, v2.22.2, v2.21.1,v2.20.2, v2.19.3, v2.18.2, v2.17.3, v2.16.6, v2.15.4, and v2.14.6.Recursive clones are currently affected by a vulnerability that is causedby too-lax validation of submodule names, allowing very targeted attacksvia remote code execution in recursive clones.

criterions.comment: git: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
